elements.title: Olympic Black Power Statue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sprinter Peter Norman requested that he be left off the Olympic Black Power Statue (pictured) so that others could stand in his place?

elements.title: Great Martyrdom of Edo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Japanese samurai was beatified by Pope Benedict XVI, nearly 400 years after his execution during the Great Martyrdom of Edo?

elements.title: Battle of Dollar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Picts disappeared from the historical record after the devastation suffered following the Battle of Dollar?

elements.title: a Wisconsin radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the operators of a Wisconsin radio station received unsolicited checks and food deliveries?

elements.title: Adam Parry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the classicist Adam Parry said that he had only ever considered three careers: academia, law and beachcombing?

elements.title: one of Charles Wesley's hymns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Isaac Watts, the "father of English hymnody", described one of Charles Wesley's hymns as "worth all the verses he himself had written"?

elements.title: a Buddhist android preacher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Buddhist android preacher regularly gives sermons on the Heart Sutra?

elements.title: Nabisco Shredded Wheat Factory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Nabisco Shredded Wheat Factory was used as a marketing tool, with an image of the factory on every cereal packet it produced until 1960?

elements.title: Bills (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bills plays for the Bills?
